column2: Formulate an ontology related to service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/service#> .ex:ServiceOntology a owl:Ontology .# Classesex:Service a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" .ex:Provider a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Provider" .ex:Customer a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Customer" .ex:Offering a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Offering" .ex:Location a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Location" .# Propertiesex:hasProvider a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Provider ;    rdfs:label "has provider" .ex:hasCustomer a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Customer ;    rdfs:label "has customer" .ex:offersService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Provider ;    rdfs:range ex:Service ;    rdfs:label "offers service" .ex:receivesService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Customer ;    rdfs:range ex:Service ;    rdfs:label "receives service" .ex:locatedAt a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Location ;    rdfs:label "located at" .ex:offers a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Provider ;    rdfs:range ex:Offering ;    rdfs:label "offers" .# Example instancesex:CleaningService a ex:Service ;    rdfs:label "Cleaning Service" .ex:JohnDoe a ex:Provider ;    rdfs:label "John Doe" .ex:JaneSmith a ex:Customer ;    rdfs:label "Jane Smith" .ex:CityCenter a ex:Location ;    rdfs:label "City Center" .ex:CleaningPackage a ex:Offering ;    rdfs:label "Cleaning Package" .# Relationsex:CleaningService ex:hasProvider ex:JohnDoe ;    ex:hasCustomer ex:JaneSmith ;    ex:locatedAt ex:CityCenter .ex:JohnDoe ex:offersService ex:CleaningService ;    ex:offers ex:CleaningPackage .ex:JaneSmith ex:receivesService ex:CleaningService .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ontology#> .ex:Service rdf:type owl:Class .ex:OnlineService rdf:type owl:Class ;  rdfs:subClassOf ex:Service .ex:CustomerSupport rdf:type owl:Class ;  rdfs:subClassOf ex:Service .ex:DeliveryService rdf:type owl:Class ;  rdfs:subClassOf ex:Service .ex:hasProvider rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Service ;  rdfs:range ex:Provider .ex:hasCustomer rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Service ;  rdfs:range ex:Customer .ex:Provider rdf:type owl:Class .ex:Customer rdf:type owl:Class .ex:hasServiceType rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Service ;  rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:hasRating rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Service ;  rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ex:offersService rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Provider ;  rdfs:range ex:Service .ex:receivesService rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;  rdfs:domain ex:Customer ;  rdfs:range ex:Service .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: service.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Service a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" ;    rdfs:comment "A service is an activity that provides some intangible benefits to users." .:Provider a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Provider" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that offers services." .:Customer a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Customer" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that uses or benefits from services." .:hasProvider a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Provider ;    rdfs:label "has provider" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to its provider." .:hasCustomer a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Customer ;    rdfs:label "has customer" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to its customer." .:hasDescription a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "has description" ;    rdfs:comment "Provides a description of the service." .:hasRating a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer ;    rdfs:label "has rating" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the rating of the service, typically on a numeric scale." .:hasCost a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range xsd:decimal ;    rdfs:label "has cost" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the cost associated with the service." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/service#> .ex:Service a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" ;    rdfs:comment "A general service offered by an organization." .ex:Provider a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Provider" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that provides a service." .ex:Client a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Client" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that receives a service." .ex:Payment a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Payment" ;    rdfs:comment "A transaction involving the exchange of a service for currency or other compensation." .ex:hasProvider a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Provider ;    rdfs:label "has provider" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to the entity that provides it." .ex:hasClient a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Client ;    rdfs:label "has client" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to the entity that receives it." .ex:hasPayment a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Payment ;    rdfs:label "has payment" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a service with the payment transaction involved." .ex:ServiceRequest a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Request" ;    rdfs:comment "An inquiry or order for a specific service." .ex:fulfillsRequest a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:ServiceRequest ;    rdfs:label "fulfills request" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a service is fulfilling a specific request." .ex:Location a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Location" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographical or virtual location where a service is provided." .ex:providedAtLocation a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:Location ;    rdfs:label "provided at location" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to the location where it is provided." .ex:ServiceCategory a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Category" ;    rdfs:comment "A classification for types of services." .ex:categorizedAs a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Service ;    rdfs:range ex:ServiceCategory ;    rdfs:label "categorized as" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the category for a service." .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/service#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Service a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" ;    rdfs:comment "An activity or benefit provided by a provider to meet the needs of a customer." .:Provider a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Provider" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that offers one or more services." .:Customer a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Customer" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that consumes or benefits from a service." .:ServiceCategory a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Category" ;    rdfs:comment "A classification of a service based on the type of service it provides." .:deliversService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Provider ;    rdfs:range :Service ;    rdfs:label "delivers service" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a provider delivers a particular service." .:receivesService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Customer ;    rdfs:range :Service ;    rdfs:label "receives service" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a customer receives a particular service." .:belongsToCategory a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :ServiceCategory ;    rdfs:label "belongs to category" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a service belongs to a specific service category." .:hasCustomer a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Customer ;    rdfs:label "has customer" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a service has a specific customer." .:hasProvider a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Provider ;    rdfs:label "has provider" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a service has a specific provider." .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: service.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .:Service rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" ;    rdfs:comment "A service provided by an entity." .:hasProvider rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Provider ;    rdfs:label "has provider" ;    rdfs:comment "Relationship between a service and its provider." .:hasCustomer rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Customer ;    rdfs:label "has customer" ;    rdfs:comment "Relationship between a service and its customer." .:hasCost rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Cost ;    rdfs:label "has cost" ;    rdfs:comment "The cost associated with a service." .:hasDuration rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Duration ;    rdfs:label "has duration" ;    rdfs:comment "The duration of time that a service lasts." .:Provider rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Provider" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that provides a service." .:Customer rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Customer" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that receives a service." .:Cost rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Cost" ;    rdfs:comment "The cost associated with a service." .:Duration rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Duration" ;    rdfs:comment "The length of time during which something occurs." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/service#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Service rdf:type owl:Class ;         rdfs:label "Service" ;         rdfs:comment "A class representing a general service." .:Provider rdf:type owl:Class ;          rdfs:label "Provider" ;          rdfs:comment "A class representing the provider of a service." .:Customer rdf:type owl:Class ;          rdfs:label "Customer" ;          rdfs:comment "A class representing the customer of a service." .:ServiceType rdf:type owl:Class ;             rdfs:label "Service Type" ;             rdfs:comment "A class representing different types of services." .:hasProvider rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;             rdfs:domain :Service ;             rdfs:range :Provider ;             rdfs:label "has provider" ;             rdfs:comment "Indicates the provider of a service." .:hasCustomer rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;             rdfs:domain :Service ;             rdfs:range :Customer ;             rdfs:label "has customer" ;             rdfs:comment "Indicates the customer of a service." .:hasServiceType rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;                rdfs:domain :Service ;                rdfs:range :ServiceType ;                rdfs:label "has service type" ;                rdfs:comment "Indicates the type of a service." .          ```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: service. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology/service#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Service a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service" ;    rdfs:comment "An activity that fulfills a request for a user or system." .:PhysicalService a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Physical Service" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Service ;    rdfs:comment "A service that requires physical presence or transaction." .:DigitalService a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Digital Service" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Service ;    rdfs:comment "A service that is provided through digital means." .:ServiceProvider a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Provider" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that offers one or more services." .:Customer a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Customer" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity that requests or consumes a service." .:ServiceType a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Type" ;    rdfs:comment "A classification of services based on common characteristics." .:hasProvider a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has provider" ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :ServiceProvider ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to its provider." .:hasCustomer a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has customer" ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :Customer ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to its customer." .:offersService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "offers service" ;    rdfs:domain :ServiceProvider ;    rdfs:range :Service ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service provider to a service they offer." .:consumesService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "consumes service" ;    rdfs:domain :Customer ;    rdfs:range :Service ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a customer to a service they consume." .:hasServiceType a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has service type" ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :ServiceType ;    rdfs:comment "Classifies a service by its type." .:isTypeOfService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "is type of service" ;    rdfs:domain :ServiceType ;    rdfs:range :Service ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a service is of a certain type." .:ServiceRequest a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Service Request" ;    rdfs:comment "A request made for a particular service." .:hasRequest a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has request" ;    rdfs:domain :Service ;    rdfs:range :ServiceRequest ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service to a service request." .:requestsService a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "requests service" ;    rdfs:domain :Customer ;    rdfs:range :ServiceRequest ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a customer to a service request they make." .:providesRequest a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "provides request" ;    rdfs:domain :ServiceProvider ;    rdfs:range :ServiceRequest ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a service provider to a service request they fulfill." .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: service.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/ontology#> .# Define the ontologyex:ServiceOntology rdf:type owl:Ontology .# Define the Service classex:Service rdf:type owl:Class ;           rdfs:label "Service" ;           rdfs:comment "A class representing a service provided, consisting of activities, inputs, outputs, and stakeholders." .# Define subclasses of Serviceex:ProfessionalService rdf:type owl:Class ;                       rdfs:subClassOf ex:Service ;                       rdfs:label "Professional Service" ;                       rdfs:comment "A service provided by professionals or experts." .ex:MaintenanceService rdf:type owl:Class ;                      rdfs:subClassOf ex:Service ;                      rdfs:label "Maintenance Service" ;                      rdfs:comment "A service focused on maintaining or repairing systems or equipment." .# Define propertiesex:providedBy rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;              rdfs:domain ex:Service ;              rdfs:range ex:Provider ;              rdfs:label "provided by" ;              rdfs:comment "Relates a service to the entity that provides it." .ex:incursCost rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;              rdfs:domain ex:Service ;              rdfs:range rdf:Literal ;              rdfs:label "incurs cost" ;              rdfs:comment "Specifies the cost associated with the service." .ex:hasOutput rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;             rdfs:domain ex:Service ;             rdfs:range ex:Output ;             rdfs:label "has output" ;             rdfs:comment "Relates a service to its output." .# Define related classesex:Provider rdf:type owl:Class ;            rdfs:label "Provider" ;            rdfs:comment "An entity that provides a service." .ex:Output rdf:type owl:Class ;          rdfs:label "Output" ;          rdfs:comment "The result or product of a service." .```
